Trial_Design.evidence: ongoing randomized clinical trial of biventricular pacing (n=11) vs. standard of care (n=9)

Participants.evidence: patients at risk of low cardiac output after heart surgery

Intervention.evidence: biventricular pacing (n=11) vs. standard of care (n=9)

Objective.evidence: We hypothesized that pacing parameters independently affect cardiac output.

Method_Outcome.evidence: Effects were measured within one hour of the conclusion of cardiopulmonary bypass.

Number_Randomised.evidence: biventricular pacing (n=11) vs. standard of care (n=9)

Number_Analysed.evidence: A sub-study was conducted in all 20 patients

Result_Outcome.evidence: Optimized pacing increased cardiac output 13% vs. atrial pacing at matched heart rate (5.5±0.5 vs. 4.9±0.6 L/min; p = 0.003)
